Al Gergawi was born in Dubai in 1963. His father, Abdulla Ali Al Gergawi, was a merchant in the city. He completed his primary and secondary school education in the emirate and attained a bachelor's degree in Business Administration from the United States.

quotes: In 2006, His Excellency Mohammad Abdullah Al Gergawi was appointed Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the UAE Government, in addition to his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC).

Between February 2016 and July 2020, Future Foresight was added to Al Gergawi’s ministerial portfolio, where he was mandated to develop the UAE’s Future Foresight Strategy aiming to promote government readiness for the future.

As the founding Chairman of the World Government Summit, His Excellency has overseen the summit since its inception in 2013, transforming it into the world's largest annual government gathering, bringing together government thought leaders, major corporate executives, future designers, and international organizations.

In addition to his ministerial duties, His Excellency holds several leading positions, including: ‎Chairman of the Executive Office of Dubai; Chairman of the World Governments Summit (WGS); Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of the Dubai Future Foundation (DFF); Secretary General of the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Global Initiatives (MBRGI); Chairman of the Museum of the Future and Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Great Arab Minds.

supporting_quotes: Between February 2016 and July 2020, Future Foresight was added to Al Gergawi’s ministerial portfolio, where he was mandated to develop the UAE’s Future Foresight Strategy aiming to promote government readiness for the future.
events.notes: Additional responsibility added to existing ministerial role.

quotes: In 2006, His Excellency Mohammad Abdullah Al Gergawi was appointed Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the UAE Government, in addition to his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC).

Between February 2016 and July 2020, Future Foresight was added to Al Gergawi’s ministerial portfolio, where he was mandated to develop the UAE’s Future Foresight Strategy aiming to promote government readiness for the future.

As the founding Chairman of the World Government Summit, His Excellency has overseen the summit since its inception in 2013, transforming it into the world's largest annual government gathering, bringing together government thought leaders, major corporate executives, future designers, and international organizations.

quotes: In February 2006, He was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial Development Council by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On September 10, 2006, he was appointed as Head of the Executive Office by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On November 13, 2007, he was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Emirates Investment Authority by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On May 20, 2008, he held the position of Co-Chair of the Global Agenda Councils established in collaboration between the UAE government and the World Economic Forum.
On September 11, 2012, he was appointed as Chairman of the World Government Summit (WGS) by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

On August 8, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum as Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of Dubai Future Museum Foundation, later known as Dubai Future Foundation.
On December 27, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum to the role of Secretary General of The Mohammed Bin Rashid Global Initiatives (MBRGI).
On February 10, 2016, HH Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, approved the new UAE Cabinet, upon which the Future portfolio was added to his ministerial functions.
On July 12, 2018, he was selected as member of the High-Level Panel on Digital Cooperation by the United Nations Secretary-General.
On May 25, 2019, he held the position of the Chairman of the Arab League’s Board of Trustees of the Arab Government Excellence Award.
On July 5, 2020, HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum announced the new UAE Cabinet and he was appointed as Minister of Cabinet Affairs.
On January 4, 2022, Al Gergawi was appointed as Chairman of the Museum of the Future.
Al Gergawi’s career started in 1987, when he joined the United Nations Development Office in Dubai Municipality.
In 1989 he was appointed Deputy Manager for revenue at the finance department.
In 1993, Al Gergawi joined Dubai’s Department of Economic Development as Director of the Department of Finance and Administration.
Al Gergawi led the launch of the Dubai Quality Award in 1994.

Al Gergawi was born in Dubai in 1963. His father, Abdulla Ali Al Gergawi, was a merchant in the city. He completed his primary and secondary school education in the emirate and attained a bachelor's degree in Business Administration from the United States.

label.label: Dubai Future Foundation
label.involvement: Co-Chairman and Managing Director; led initiatives in future technologies and innovation.
label.reasoning: Founding and leadership roles in a key organization focused on future-oriented development.

supporting_quotes: On August 8, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum as Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of Dubai Future Museum Foundation, later known as Dubai Future Foundation.

quotes: In February 2006, He was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial Development Council by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On September 10, 2006, he was appointed as Head of the Executive Office by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On November 13, 2007, he was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Emirates Investment Authority by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On May 20, 2008, he held the position of Co-Chair of the Global Agenda Councils established in collaboration between the UAE government and the World Economic Forum.
On September 11, 2012, he was appointed as Chairman of the World Government Summit (WGS) by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

On August 8, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum as Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of Dubai Future Museum Foundation, later known as Dubai Future Foundation.
On December 27, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum to the role of Secretary General of The Mohammed Bin Rashid Global Initiatives (MBRGI).
On February 10, 2016, HH Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, approved the new UAE Cabinet, upon which the Future portfolio was added to his ministerial functions.
On July 12, 2018, he was selected as member of the High-Level Panel on Digital Cooperation by the United Nations Secretary-General.
On May 25, 2019, he held the position of the Chairman of the Arab League’s Board of Trustees of the Arab Government Excellence Award.
On July 5, 2020, HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum announced the new UAE Cabinet and he was appointed as Minister of Cabinet Affairs.
On January 4, 2022, Al Gergawi was appointed as Chairman of the Museum of the Future.
Al Gergawi’s career started in 1987, when he joined the United Nations Development Office in Dubai Municipality.
In 1989 he was appointed Deputy Manager for revenue at the finance department.
In 1993, Al Gergawi joined Dubai’s Department of Economic Development as Director of the Department of Finance and Administration.
Al Gergawi led the launch of the Dubai Quality Award in 1994.

label.label: World Economic Forum (WEF)
label.involvement: Member of the Leadership Council and Global Leadership Council; participated in global economic and policy discussions.
label.reasoning: Long-term involvement in a major global organization, indicating significant influence in international affairs.

supporting_quotes: At the international level, Al Gergawi is member of the World Economic Forum (WEF) Leadership Council, supervising the long-term strategy of the Forum
events.notes: Active membership with strategic responsibilities.

quotes: In 2006, His Excellency Mohammad Abdullah Al Gergawi was appointed Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the UAE Government, in addition to his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC).

Between February 2016 and July 2020, Future Foresight was added to Al Gergawi’s ministerial portfolio, where he was mandated to develop the UAE’s Future Foresight Strategy aiming to promote government readiness for the future.

As the founding Chairman of the World Government Summit, His Excellency has overseen the summit since its inception in 2013, transforming it into the world's largest annual government gathering, bringing together government thought leaders, major corporate executives, future designers, and international organizations.

organizations.name: UAE Government
quotes: In 2006, His Excellency Mohammad Abdullah Al Gergawi was appointed Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the UAE Government, in addition to his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC).

organizations.name: Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC)
quotes: In 2006, His Excellency Mohammad Abdullah Al Gergawi was appointed Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the UAE Government, in addition to his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC).

organizations.name: Executive Office of Dubai

In 2006, His Excellency Mohammad Abdullah Al Gergawi was appointed Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the UAE Government, in addition to his capacity as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial ‎Development Council (MDC).

In addition to his ministerial duties, His Excellency holds several leading positions, including: ‎Chairman of the Executive Office of Dubai; Chairman of the World Governments Summit (WGS); Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of the Dubai Future Foundation (DFF); Secretary General of the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Global Initiatives (MBRGI); Chairman of the Museum of the Future and Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Great Arab Minds.

supporting_quotes: On May 20, 2008, he held the position of Co-Chair of the Global Agenda Councils established in collaboration between the UAE government and the World Economic Forum.

quotes: In February 2006, He was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial Development Council by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On September 10, 2006, he was appointed as Head of the Executive Office by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On November 13, 2007, he was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Emirates Investment Authority by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On May 20, 2008, he held the position of Co-Chair of the Global Agenda Councils established in collaboration between the UAE government and the World Economic Forum.
On September 11, 2012, he was appointed as Chairman of the World Government Summit (WGS) by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

On August 8, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum as Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of Dubai Future Museum Foundation, later known as Dubai Future Foundation.
On December 27, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum to the role of Secretary General of The Mohammed Bin Rashid Global Initiatives (MBRGI).
On February 10, 2016, HH Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, approved the new UAE Cabinet, upon which the Future portfolio was added to his ministerial functions.
On July 12, 2018, he was selected as member of the High-Level Panel on Digital Cooperation by the United Nations Secretary-General.
On May 25, 2019, he held the position of the Chairman of the Arab League’s Board of Trustees of the Arab Government Excellence Award.
On July 5, 2020, HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum announced the new UAE Cabinet and he was appointed as Minister of Cabinet Affairs.
On January 4, 2022, Al Gergawi was appointed as Chairman of the Museum of the Future.
Al Gergawi’s career started in 1987, when he joined the United Nations Development Office in Dubai Municipality.
In 1989 he was appointed Deputy Manager for revenue at the finance department.
In 1993, Al Gergawi joined Dubai’s Department of Economic Development as Director of the Department of Finance and Administration.
Al Gergawi led the launch of the Dubai Quality Award in 1994.

quotes: Al Gergawi founded the Dubai Holding and served as its Chairman until 2017, playing a pivotal role in the establishment of several specialized cities.

quotes: In 1994, he held the position of Secretary General of Dubai Quality Award.
In 1997, he held the position of Deputy Director at the Department of Economic Development (DED) Dubai and was appointed as Secretary General of Dubai Government Excellence Program.
In 1999, he was appointed as President of Dubai Internet City by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
In 2000, he was appointed as Director General of Dubai Technology, E-Commerce and Media Free Zone Authority by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
In 2000, he was appointed as Head of the Executive Office in Dubai by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
In 2002, he was appointed as Chairman of the Board of Directors, Dubai Development and Investment Authority (DDIA), by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On March 3, 2003, he was appointed as Secretary General of the Executive Council of the Emirate of Dubai by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
In 2003, he held the position of Managing Director of Dubai Media Incorporated (DMI).
In 2004, he was appointed as Chairman of Dubai Holding company by HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On February 10, 2006, HH Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, issued a Federal Decree on the formation of the UAE Cabinet; he was appointed as Minister

He completed his primary and secondary school education in the emirate and attained a bachelor’s degree from the United States.
is an Emirati politician who is the Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the United Arab Emirates and the Chairman of the Executive Office in Dubai.

supporting_quotes: On September 10, 2006, he was appointed as Head of the Executive Office by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

quotes: In February 2006, He was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Ministerial Development Council by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On September 10, 2006, he was appointed as Head of the Executive Office by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On November 13, 2007, he was appointed as Deputy Chairman of the Emirates Investment Authority by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.
On May 20, 2008, he held the position of Co-Chair of the Global Agenda Councils established in collaboration between the UAE government and the World Economic Forum.
On September 11, 2012, he was appointed as Chairman of the World Government Summit (WGS) by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

On August 8, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum as Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees and Managing Director of Dubai Future Museum Foundation, later known as Dubai Future Foundation.
On December 27, 2015, he was appointed by HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum to the role of Secretary General of The Mohammed Bin Rashid Global Initiatives (MBRGI).
On February 10, 2016, HH Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, approved the new UAE Cabinet, upon which the Future portfolio was added to his ministerial functions.
On July 12, 2018, he was selected as member of the High-Level Panel on Digital Cooperation by the United Nations Secretary-General.
On May 25, 2019, he held the position of the Chairman of the Arab League’s Board of Trustees of the Arab Government Excellence Award.
On July 5, 2020, HH Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum announced the new UAE Cabinet and he was appointed as Minister of Cabinet Affairs.
On January 4, 2022, Al Gergawi was appointed as Chairman of the Museum of the Future.
Al Gergawi’s career started in 1987, when he joined the United Nations Development Office in Dubai Municipality.
In 1989 he was appointed Deputy Manager for revenue at the finance department.
In 1993, Al Gergawi joined Dubai’s Department of Economic Development as Director of the Department of Finance and Administration.
Al Gergawi led the launch of the Dubai Quality Award in 1994.

November 28, 2024, Cairo – The American University in Cairo (AUC) welcomed His Excellency Mohammad bin Abdullah Al Gergawi, Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the United Arab Emirates, during a special visit to its campus.

November 28, 2024, Cairo – The American University in Cairo (AUC) welcomed His Excellency Mohammad bin Abdullah Al Gergawi, Minister of Cabinet Affairs of the United Arab Emirates, during a special visit to its campus.
